intro: Rhynchospora pusilla, commonly known as the small-flowered flat sedge, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and has narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters at the tips of its stems. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs, fens, and along the edges of ponds. Rhynchospora pusilla plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
